website_summaries.verdict: This remarkably comfortable dressing stick is the perfect choice for shorter buyers wanting a gentle grip.
pros: The 24-inch design is perfect for users needing a smaller, lightweight dressing stick
Convenient "s"-shaped hook for easy clothing control
Stick is covered with a foam handle for gentle grip
cons: A few customers claimed the hooks were too thick, making them useless when working with certain zippers

customer_reviews.title: Super Handy Tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing is priceless when you need it!! Well made too. Last one lasted many years.
customer_reviews.author: obars

customer_reviews.title: I have will continue to recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Dressing stick is well made, not only helps in dressing, but help with bedcovers. Aids with independence and feeling of self. I have will continue to recommend this product .
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Chipchosky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent help for one-handed dtessing!
customer_reviews.text: After my stroke 6 years ago, I had several tools for dressing. This one is the best by far. The covered tip keeps it comfortable wjen pulling pants over sensitive legs.. The padding makes it easy to grip from any angle. Excellent for dressing.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Uduh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My wife has back fused and helps her get dressed and undressed with out my help!
customer_reviews.author: Kirby

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed with the thickness of the hook
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with the thickness of the hook. I assumed I could use it for zippers, but it is too thick. Shoe horn end is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Great Recovery Tool
customer_reviews.text: I recently had hip replacement surgery. One of the best and most reasonable purchases I made to assist me in doing things for myself. Easy to use and will help even when I return to a normal lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: J Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool but not too necessary
customer_reviews.text: It was strongly recommended to buy this when have total knee replacement but I found that I could just as easily slide on my pants and socks and that that stretching helped improve muscle tone. For those with a back back or who simply cannot reach their shoes and socks, it can be a helpful tool.
customer_reviews.author: DocTheology

customer_reviews.title: Great dressing aid.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool to assist in dressing myself following fusion back surgery. I love that one end of the hook has a rubber tip that really helps grab the clothes. The shoe horn at the other end is also an asset. I wouldn't use it for lifting or pulling very heavy items as it could break. This tool worked much better than the one used in the hospital by the OT therapists. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: P. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Soft & Works!
customer_reviews.text: I got both this style--plastic--and a wooden stick with hook on end. I hate the latter as it doesn't work well getting off socks. This plastic one is very soft against my skin, the thick blue handle is easy on my hands, and it works!
customer_reviews.author: James Tiberius

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Had one for over 10 years, It was used every day, sadly the white shoe horn broke, super glued it but it didn't work. So we bought same one. The hook end works great to bring your shoe close to your foot with out bending over.
customer_reviews.author: thornton smith

product_meta.title: Blue Jay Dressing Stick - 24'' Soft Foam-Covered Handle, 2-in-1 Tool, Dressing Made Easy, Rounded S Plastic top Hook, No Stretching or Straining Shoehorn Dressing Aid
feature_bullets: Ergonomic Dressing Stick: a convenient 2-in-1 tool that is made to assist in putting on shoes and getting dressed. Foam covered handle – ideal for comfort and easy to grip

Dimensions: extra-long 24" long handle helps reduce stretching and bending. Recommended by many health professionals and therapists. Shoe-horn style dressing stick helps you easily slide your heel into any shoe style
Design: rounded ‘S’ shaped plastic top hook is useful for picking up, pulling clothing from the floor and much more. Soft to touch

Benefits: with the dressing aid you don’t have to bend over while taking off or putting on your shoes. From picking up clothing off the floor to pulling any essentials in the drawer, you can conveniently use this dressing stick with a hook
Dressing Aid: the stick has a bend to assist with pulling up pants, putting on shirts, and helping put on shoes, or removing socks
